messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: [Unschooling-dotcom) St Joseph
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.catholic-forum.com/saints/sainta01.htm There s St. Anthony of Padua, patron saint of seekers of lost articles. He s the one, if you lose your keys
messages.messageBody:
http://www.catholic-forum.com/saints/sainta01.htm

There's St. Anthony of Padua, patron saint of seekers of lost articles.

He's the one, if you lose your keys or your passport.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom) St Joseph
messages.msgSnippet: ... we moved.   Something about burying St.Joseph head down or toward the house.  He is patron of homes and families,  so this is generally used when a family
messages.messageBody:
>>>I think you are referring to St. Joseph. I learned this last year when
we moved. Something about burying St.Joseph head down or toward the
house. He is patron of homes and families, so this is generally used
when a family is moving. <<<

St Joe is also good for when your house won't sell. Bury him head down in the back yard and pray for a new family. <g>

Kay, a loooong-lapsed Catholic who still has statues of the Blessed Mother in her car

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
